report.report_text:
[Report de-identified (Safe-harbor compliant) by De-ID v.6.22.06.0]
EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT PATIENT RECORD **INSTITUTION **PLACE, PA **ZIP-CODE _____________________________________________________
**NAME[AAA, BBB M] **ID-NUM A5A 1
DATE OF SERVICE **DATE[Jun 23 06]
This is a **AGE[in 70s]-year-old female patient presenting to the emergency department complaining of a hematoma to her right gluteal area and weakness. The patient sustained a fall 2 days ago in her bathroom and has a large hematoma over the right buttocks area. She was seen by her PCP in the office today and because of the expanding buttocks and gluteal hematoma, sent to the emergency department now for further evaluation. She has complained also of weakness. Fall was precipitated by loss of balance. She is denying lightheaded or dizziness. She denies back pain. Denies chest or abdominal pain. Denies shortness of breath.
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: Significant for atherosclerotic heart disease, atrial fibrillation, mitral valve prolapse, diabetes mellitus, and hypertension. She has an intracoronary stent.
MEDICATIONS: Her medications currently include Celexa, Coumadin, Actoplus, Restoril, folic acid, Zocor, Benicar, Lopressor, Imdur, aspirin, Plavix, and Lasix.
ALLERGIES: DEMEROL.
REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Negative for anorexia or weight loss. Is denying exercise dyspnea, orthopnea, or PND. Denies history specific for prior gastrointestinal problems. No history specific for genitourinary dysfunction. She has known cardiac problems. No strokes. No seizures. No visual disturbances. Remainder of the review of systems is negative.
SOCIAL HISTORY: She drinks wine on a social basis. Nonsmoker.
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: GENERAL: The exam is showing an alert and oriented elderly female in no acute distress. VITAL SIGNS: The patient on exam has a BP of 99/54, pulse of 53 and regular, respirations 18 and unlabored, saturation 98% on room air, and temperature of 97.6. HEENT: The patient on exam of the head, eyes, ears, nose, and throat showed her to be normocephalic. Pupils are equal, round, and reactive. Extraocular movements are intact. Sclerae nonicteric. No oral mucosal changes. NECK: Supple. No JVD, thyromegaly, or carotid bruits. LUNGS: Clear to auscultation. HEART: Regular rhythm. No murmurs. ABDOMEN: Soft and nontender. EXTREMITIES: She has a large hematoma over the right gluteal area measuring approximately 8 cm to 9 cm with some moderate tenderness overlying the hematoma. She has some ecchymotic changes over the volar aspects of both upper extremities. No deformities noted. NEUROLOGIC: She currently is awake, alert, and oriented without focal motor or sensory deficits.
Workup has included sodium of 128, potassium of 3.8, chloride of 92, and CO2 of 30 with a glucose of 139, BUN of 10, and creatinine of 0.7. Troponin is 0.04 with a white count of 8.3 and H and H of 9.9 and 28.3. INR was at 3.8 with a prothrombin time of 45.1. On rectal exam, stool Hemoccult was negative for blood. This patient had a CT of the abdomen and pelvis, which failed to show abnormal retroperitoneal or intraabdominal fluid collections. She had a CT of the hip, which failed to show fractures. She did have the soft tissue swelling and hematoma as noted on her examination in the gluteal region. She has remained stable in the emergency department. EKG is showing atrial fibrillation with controlled ventricular response. The case was discussed with her PCP. The assessment currently is anemia, ground-level fall, gluteal hematoma, and mild coagulopathy induced by Coumadin. She will be admitted to a flex monitored bed for further care and evaluation.
_____________________________ **NAME[WWW M. XXX], M.D.
